intro: Renealmia lutea, commonly known as the golden renealmia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and bright yellow flowers that bloom in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Renealmia lutea is often found in marshy areas and is adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils.
